decks.notes: This deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and cycling to quickly build up a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The goal is to cycle through cards quickly to find key pieces while also dealing direct damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards with cycling abilities and strong synergies between creatures and spells, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a victory before they can effectively respond.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful creatures. The player aims to maintain board control while ramping up their mana and finding their key cards with card draw and selection effects. With Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the player can repeatedly flicker their permanents for additional value. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Emergent Ultimatum and Kiora Bests the Sea God to close out the game once they have established control.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through graveyard manipulation and card advantage. Using cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Soaring Thought-Thief, and Ruin Crab, you aim to mill your opponent's deck while benefiting from their graveyard being filled. Drown in the Loch and Into the Story provide you with powerful spells that scale well into the late game. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game by denying your opponent resources and overwhelming them with a steady stream of threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence and attacking the opponent aggressively. By playing efficient creatures like Questing Beast and Brushfire Elemental, along with powerful spells like Embercleave, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lovestruck Beast helps to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on. With a mix of creatures and burn spells, this Gruul Aggro deck aims to close out games quickly and decisively.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a combination of creature threats and disruptive spells to control the board and put pressure on the opponent. Utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn and The Akroan War to steal and sacrifice creatures, alongside Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger for constant pressure and disruption. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Heartless Act to deal with threats. The mana base is designed to provide a consistent and smooth curve for optimal performance in each match.

The main focus of this Red Deck Wins archetype is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent using cheap, efficient creatures like Fervent Champion and Robber of the Rich, combined with powerful finishers like Embercleave. Torbran, Thane of Red Fell boosts all red sources of damage, while Anax, Hardened in the Forge creates tokens to maintain pressure. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountain enables the use of Frost Bite for extra removal. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently to secure a swift victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a wide range of removal spells and disruptive creatures. By carefully managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to stabilize the board and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of powerful threats such as Kiora Bests the Sea God, Professor Onyx, and Emergent Ultimatum provides the deck with various win conditions and ways to close out the game. Additionally, the versatility of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the deck's strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells in order to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By including Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion, the deck focuses on odd CMC cards to take advantage of its ability. Goldspan Dragon, Edgewall Innkeeper, and other powerful creatures help to maintain pressure on the opponent while control spells like Saw It Coming and Mystical Dispute provide disruption and protection. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent color access for all the powerful spells in the deck.

The main focus of this deck is to delay and control the opponent's actions while utilizing mill and card advantage to win the game. By utilizing cards like Merfolk Windrobber, Ruin Crab, and Soaring Thought-Thief to mill the opponent's deck, and Thieves' Guild Enforcer to take advantage of that mill, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With counterspells like Disdainful Stroke and Mystical Dispute, along with removal spells like Heartless Act and Eliminate, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The deck also utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion for additional value.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards that have cycling abilities to quickly cycle through the deck and fill up the graveyard with cards. The key strategy is to utilize cards that benefit from cycling, such as Zenith Flare and Improbable Alliance, to deal damage to the opponent and win the game. By cycling through the deck quickly, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures, ultimately securing victory through aggressive play and efficient use of resources.

The focus of this deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful creatures. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanent cards. The deck aims to stall the game with early game ramp and disruption spells, before using Emergent Ultimatum to find powerful threats or game-winning spells. By controlling the board and resource advantage, the deck can ultimately outvalue and outlast the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful enchantments. It also utilizes ramp spells to quickly get to its high-costed threats. With the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad providing extra value by blinking permanents for additional benefits, the deck aims to outvalue opponents by creating card advantage and tempo swings. The deck has a strong late game with powerful finishers like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany, while also having ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Mystical Dispute and Shadows' Verdict.

The key concept of this deck is to leverage the power of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a Companion to maximize damage output with odd-costed creatures like Goldspan Dragon, Edgewall Innkeeper, and Bonecrusher Giant. The deck focuses on a fast, aggressive playstyle with Temur colors, utilizing efficient creatures and disruption spells like Brazen Borrower and Mystical Dispute to control the board and push damage through. The Great Henge provides card advantage and life gain, while Alrund's Epiphany offers extra turns to further pressure the opponent. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and decisively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures like Brazen Borrower, Goldspan Dragon, and Lovestruck Beast to pressure the opponent early on. The deck also utilizes cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge to draw cards and gain advantage. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the deck's damage output. The deck also includes counter spells like Mystical Dispute and Saw It Coming for disruption. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and strong creatures while maintaining card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly playing small, efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless swarm of creatures. By using cards like Usher of the Fallen and Luminarch Aspirant to build a board presence, the deck can apply pressure early on. Cards like Drannith Magistrate and Elite Spellbinder disrupt the opponent's strategy, giving the deck an advantage. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Maul of the Skyclaves helps to further increase the deck's aggression. Overall, the deck aims to win by quickly overwhelming the opponent with a fast and efficient army of creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The key strategy revolves around efficiently utilizing cards that provide value for their mana cost, such as Skyclave Apparition and Seasoned Hallowblade, while also maintaining protection for important creatures like Luminarch Aspirant and Speaker of the Heavens. Additionally, the inclusion of Maul of the Skyclaves allows for additional combat tricks and buffs to further bolster the aggression of the deck.
